content: Steven, these allegations by Susan Fowler, if proven true, indicate a serious gender bias (conscious or unconscious) in major corporations. The leather jackets incident is possibly a case of gender discrimination. But there could be other reasons as well. Corporate greed — save money by ordering in bulk even if that means leaving out a small percentage of employees. Incompetence — the guy who worked out the deal just did not realize there will be a minority population who will not benefit from it Arrogance/ego — how can a senior manager let a normal engineer question his decision!
